availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Originally organized as the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment, but subsequently renamed as the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment. Organized at Camp Dick Robinson in Garrard County, Kentucky. Mustered into service on October 8, 1861. Mustered out of service on October 18, 1864. Commander(s): Colonel Thomas E. Bramlette, Colonel William T. Scott, Colonel Samuel McKee, Colonel William H. Spencer, and Colonel Henry C. Dunlap.

ab.bibl: Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1 (Frankfort: John H. Harney, Public Printer, 1866), 592-629.
